thread.title: 1/2 off id stuff on Steam this weekend!

post.author: stabinbac
post.body:
Including the Super Pack!


"Includes: Quake III Arena, Wolfenstein 3D, Ultimate DOOM, Final DOOM, DOOM II, QUAKE, QUAKE II, QUAKE II Mission Pack: The Reckoning, QUAKE II Mission Pack: Ground Zero, QUAKE III: Team Arena, HeXen, HeXen: Deathkings of the Dark Citadel, Heretic: Shadow of the Serpent Riders, Spear of Destiny, Return to Castle Wolfenstein, QUAKE Mission Pack 2: Dissolution of Eternity, QUAKE Mission Pack 1: Scourge of Armagon, DOOM 3, HeXen II, DOOM 3 Resurrection of Evil, Master Levels for Doom II, Commander Keen"

For $35!!!

post.author: The Happy Friar
post.body: saw that not long ago. imho, THAT should the the PERMANENT price. id's charging to much. I might actually buy keen @ $2.50.

post.author: Jack Rammsdell
post.body: Just bought it can't beat the price.

post.author: Brain Trepaning
post.body: DO I get an actual ISO or somesuch that I can keep around on disk and install at my leisure, or will I have to hook up to Steam when I want to install one of the programs?

post.author: stabinbac
post.body:
It's through Steam. You'll have to be connected to download. Steam has an offline mode.

You can also "backup" games. It allows for faster re-installs and it can be run from CDs. It saves you from having to download it again, but requires a very quick check with the steam servers. You can play right away unless an update is "needed".

Yeah, it's steam.

It's $35 for 22 games and expansions. Not bad at all.

post.author: The Happy Friar
post.body:
screw steam. It's the SAME data files as you get on a CD. Except for Quake 2 & 3, all run with the origional EXE's under DOSBOX. The ONLY thing you can't get a GPL engine for (from what I understand) is Keen. So get a custom engine & burn all those + the custom engine to a CD/DVD.

Tell Steam/id to go to heck & you're keeping it YOU way!

post.author: Brain Trepaning
post.body: The thing is, for me anyway, I doubt I would ever actually play the games, but it would be cool to have a DVD or two with all of id's library in one spot, and I would pay $35 for that.
